reviews.review_msg: Endre is an overall really solid prof! Generally really encouraging, and he really enjoys hearing students' perspective on philosophy. He's not an easy grader by any means, but he gives good feedback so that you can improve. He doesn't have slides for online classes, so be prepared to talk a lot in class discussions

One of my favourite profs in the Phil department. Sam inspired me to go to law school, and has always given me great feedback and advice even when I wasn't a student of his. I'm so grateful to have taken several classes with him. His lectures are interesting and he truly cares for his students. can't recommend enough

I'm not gonna lie, the class was not THE most attention grabbing- but Sam still managed to make class worth showing up for. You can tell he's passionate about the subject, and doesn't use that as an excuse to give mediocre lectures. He tried to be a bit more lenient with grading this time around due to the current world situation-very appreciated!

Posts all lecture notes. Doesn't use visuals during lecture, but tries to change it up to be interesting. Passionate and good at explaining things he's prepared, but doesn't answer student questions well. Uses lot's of examples. Always available and willing to help. Nice guy, generous grader.

Good teacher, very clear with instructions. If you need an upper level elective gpa booster, phil 329 with Chelsea is the class. No need to attend lecture or read any of the readings. Just do a short writing assignment once a month, and two fairly short papers that are easy to write about and thats it. Marks easy too.

Chelsea is one of my favorite phil profs! She is caring, open-minded, and receptive to any contributions in class discussions, so participating is definitely less intimidating. The material might not be for everyone but she still explains them very well. Her lectures were online, but I'm not sure if it'll change to in-person in the future.

Dr. Rosenthal is a kind-hearted and thought-provoking professor who clearly loves what she does. She is regularly accessible during office hours and encourages students to participate in class by posing insightful questions. The papers are both on the longer side, but the content is dense, so it makes sense. I strongly recommend having her!
Chelsea is a great prof! Her lectures focus on a wide range of topics but she does a good job of making sure her students understand the main points.

Evan is a top-notch professor. Very knowledgeable, with clear and fair expectations. Although he grades on a very steep scale, high marks were achievable if you focused during class and did the readings. Using Perusall as a communal reading platform was helpful and an easy grade booster.

Would recommend!
fantastic prof. super funny and helpful, fair grading and expectations. awesome class
